game.deck: A spin-off from the long-running JRPG series, Builders tasks the player with rebuilding the ruined world of Alfegard... using some very familiar looking square blocks.
game.description:
Overview

Dragon Quest Builders is a spin-off from the long-running fantasy JRPG franchise Dragon Quest. In a significant departure from the usual games in the franchise, the game world is composed of large square blocks, very reminiscent of Minecraft.

Plot

The game takes place in Alfegard - the world of the original NES Dragon Warrior, now ravaged by the Dragonlord. With the land around them in ruin, the player is tasked with rebuilding and restoring it to its former splendor.
game.name: Dragon Quest Builders

game.deck: Moero!! Pro Yakyuu is a remake of the first game in the Moero!! series (known as Bases Loaded in the US) and the first Moero!! game released since 2004.
game.name: Moero!! Pro Yakyuu

game.deck: Hob is an action-adventure that takes place in a world that is beautiful and full of life on its surface, yet filled with failing machinery beneath the surface. The player is encouraged to learn and discover through exploring the world as the game offers no narration or dialogue.
game.name: Hob

game.deck: Grand Ages: Medieval is a grand strategy game where players attempt to conquer all of Europe in 1050 A.D. It was released on September 26th 2015 for PC, Mac, and PlayStation 4.
game.description:
Overview

Grand Ages Medieval is a Grand Strategy game from Gaming Minds. The game starts with the player controlling one town/city and playing as the Mayor and eventually being able to expand to rule an Empire that stretches across Europe. To do this the player can construct new building, research new technologies, expand the scale of their settlements and to conquer enemies and friends. Trade and the economy also play a large role in this game as there are over 20 different resources that are able to be produced and traded.
game.name: Grand Ages: Medieval

game.deck: The third game in the open world crime series. Mafia III follows Vietnam veteran Lincoln Clay in 1960s New Orleans, as he aspires for revenge against those who have harmed his family.
game.description:
Overview

Mafia III is the third installment in the Mafia franchise. Developed by newly formed Hangar 13 and published by 2K Games, the game is set to release in 2016.

Set in 1968 New Orleans, Louisiana, the story follows Lincoln Clay, a Vietnam veteran who comes home to find a family in the Black Mafia. After being betrayed by the Italian mafia, Clay seeks revenge against everyone who has wronged him and his family.
game.name: Mafia III

Jack-O'

game.aliases: Dead or Alive Xtreme 3: Venus DOAX3 Fortune DOAX3 Venus
game.deck: The third title in the Dead or Alive Xtreme series, which is currently only planned for release in Japan and Asian territories.
game.description:
Overview

Dead or Alive Xtreme 3: Fortune for PlayStation 4 contains support for Sony's PlayStation VR headset. The PlayStation Vita version of the game is known as Dead or Alive Xtreme 3: Venus. The game is not planned for release outside of Japan, but Koei Tecmo has stated that if it ever was released in other regions, then it would have to be "adjusted" for those regions.

Characters

The nine playable characters in the game were selected based on the total PlayStation Store purchases of dashboard themes from Dead or Alive 5 Last Round between August 20 and September 7, 2015. Only purchases from Japan counted towards the results and the final roster was announced during the 2015 Tokyo Game Show. The top nine include:

  • Marie Rose - 17.6%
  • Honoka - 14.9%
  • Kasumi - 12.0%
  • Ayane - 8.2%
  • Kokoro - 8.0%
  • Nyotengu - 7.6%
  • Hitomi - 5.9%
  • Momiji - 5.1%
  • Helena Douglas - 4.9%

As the most popular character, Marie Rose has a "devil" costume available for those who purchase the PS4 version of the game at launch. An "angel" costume for Honoka (2nd place) is included with the launch day PS Vita version.

Notably, characters such as Tina Armstrong and Lei Fang, who have been in every Dead or Alive game since the beginning, did not make the cut. Koei Tecmo claims there are no plans to add characters via DLC. Those not making the cut include:

  • Lei Fang - 4.7%
  • Tina Armstrong - 3.9%
  • Mila - 2.6%
  • Rachel - 1.8%
  • Christie - 1.5%
  • Lisa - 1.4%
game.name: Dead or Alive Xtreme 3: Fortune

Overview

game.deck: A One Piece fighting game developed by Spike Chunsoft for PlayStation 4, PlayStation Vita, and Xbox One.
game.description:
Overview

Announced during PlayStation's Tokyo Game Show press event, One Piece: Burning Blood is a fighting game developed by Spike Chunsoft for PlayStation 4 and PlayStation Vita; an Xbox One version was later announced for the western release.

The game will feature various characters from throughout the entire One Piece series in intense one on one battles.
game.name: One Piece: Burning Blood

game.deck: Final Kingdom Hearts HD Compilation containing an HD version of Dream Drop Distance and two brand new episodes. Unlike the two previous compilations, which were on Playstation 3, this one is for Playstation 4.
game.description:
Overview

Kingdom Hearts HD II.8: Final Chapter Prologue follows HD 1.5 ReMIX & HD 2.5 ReMIX on Playstation 3. Those contained two full games and an HD movie based on a DS game. This compilation follows the same formula but is slightly different in execution.

Contents

Dream Drop Distance HD

Dream Drop Distance was originally released for the Nintendo 3DS, this is a full playable edition of the game. It takes place after Kingdom Hearts II & Re: Coded and leads into Kingdom Hearts III. It appears to be a straight port of the game with no new content, though touch screen mechanics will be altered to play on a single screen.

χ [chi] Back Cover

Kingdom Hearts χ [chi] started out available in Japan as a browser game before being remade as Unchained χ [chi] for mobile, which was released worldwide. Back Cover is an HD movie that will trend over some territory as the previous versions but will expand on the previous versions with new content as well. While the playable versions tell the story from the player's perspective, Back Cover tells the story from the perspective of the major characters The Foretellers. It takes place the farthest back in the timeline the series has gone to date.

0.2 Birth by Sleep – A Fragmentary Passage –

Birth by Sleep is a prequel that takes place 10 years before Kingdom Hearts. It was originally released for the PSP and was also included in HD 2.5 ReMIX. The Final Mix version contains a playable secret ending starring Aqua fighting the Heartless. This is a brand new playable episode (series director Tetsuya Nomura stated it's about the length of a single Kingdom Hearts world), that takes place some time after the original secret ending but still before Kingdom Hearts. Unlike all other content in the Kingdom Hearts HD compilations, this is being made in the same engine that Kingdom Hearts III is being made in and will combine gameplay systems from Birth by Sleep and Kingdom Hearts III.
game.name: Kingdom Hearts HD II.8: Final Chapter Prologue

game.deck: Jackbox Games returns with five more comedic party games.
game.description:
Games

Quiplash XL

Contains all of the prompts from the original game, the Quip Pack 1 DLC, and brand new prompts.

Fibbage 2

More questions and new features like getting to choose own sound effect and having audience participation.

Bomb Corp

Players and their friends are interns at the titular Bomb Corp where players will have to work together to do regular intern tasks and also stop bombs from blowing up.

Earwax

Players have to choose sound effects that best describe a phrase.

Bidiots

Similar to Drawful, but instead, players draw a picture and bid on other players' friends pictures. Whoever gets the most profit from these pictures wins.
game.name: The Jackbox Party Pack 2

game.deck: Thrilling story-oriented sci-fi adventure on Mars. Puzzles, mysteries, hidden clues and objects... follow the three young astronauts trying to survive in the abandoned dome city.
game.description:
Overview

Dome City is a first person view sci-fi adventure game developed by Overon Station. The narrative takes the player along with three young astronauts as they get stuck in an abandoned dome city on Mars, where they need to solve the puzzles and find out the mysteries of the town to be able to survive and escape. Their journey is replayable and will be available in single player mode.

The Story

Ariel, Don and Lars are three young space cadets. We meet them on their way to the last exam of the training - they're heading to the Moon with a cool, brand new expedition spaceship. Suddenly they're ordered to make an emergency landing on Mars, and after the guys leave the ship, it gets stolen and they're stuck in the abandoned city without food and water.

Gameplay

It's a story-oriented single player adventure. The main task is to figure out how to survive, discovering the rusty-old buildings and deserted streets for hidden tools and hints. Solve the puzzles of different difficulty levels to get through closed doors, build useful gadgets or put together edible victuals.
game.name: Dome City

game.deck: The Park is a first person psychological horror game from the developers of The Secret World.
game.description:
Plot

The Park is set in Atlantic Island Park after dark. Lorraine has lost her son, Callum, and must traverse the park in order to find him.

Atlantic Island Park is on Solomon Island, off the coast of Maine, from the MMO The Secret World. The amusement park itself can also be seen in The Secret World as a location in which the player can complete quests.

Gameplay

The Park is a first person exploration adventure game where the players interaction with the environment is limited to finding documents to read, listening to the soliloquies that Lorraine will sometimes give as you walk, and riding creepy amusement park rides.

It is a game mainly focused on storytelling so there is no combat and very little in the way of puzzles. As Lorraine, the player is mainly tasked with moving forward, and discovering items that explain the story further while Lorraine occasionally gives her own backstory.

The player can also have Lorraine call out for her son which gives a slight hint as to which direction you should go if you are lost.

Development

The Park was developed as part of a new business strategy by Funcom. After announcing financial troubles in August of 2015 they then announced they wanted to look into developing small scale, experimental, and innovative titles with their existing IP. They would do this in order to develop their team's ability to create different kinds of games as well as gauge market interests.

The Park is the first title with this idea in mind.

As of this writing The Park is scheduled to be released on PS4 and XBOXone in Q1 of 2016. It will be Funcom's first console release since Dreamfall: The Longest Journey on the original XBOX.

PC System Requirements

Steam is required to play The Park

Minimum

OS: Windows 7 (64 bit), Windows 8 (64 bit), Windows 10 (64 bit)

Processor: Core i5 or equivalent

RAM: 4 GB

Graphics: Intel HD440 / AMD Radeon 5750 1GB VRAM / NVIDIA Geforce 640 1GB VRAM

Direct X: 11

Hard Drive: 4 GB available space

Recommended

OS: Windows 7 (64 bit), Windows 8 (64 bit), Windows 10 (64 bit)

Processor: Core i5 or equivalent

RAM: 8 GB

Graphics: NVIDIA 760 series 2GB VRAM or better / AMD Radeon R9 270x 2GB VRAM or better

Direct X: 11

Hard Drive: 4 GB available space
game.name: The Park

game.deck: The definitive version of arcade-style shoot-'em-up Darius Burst, containing the enhancements from the Another Chronicle EX arcade version as well as new content.
game.description:
Overview

Darius Burst: Chronicle Saviours is a sci-fi shoot 'em up developed by Pyramid for PC and PlayStation platforms. It contains a port of the arcade game Darius Burst: Another Chronicle EX -- which in itself was an updated and expanded version of Darius Burst for the PSP -- in addition to a large amount of new content created specifically for the home version.

Gameplay

Like all games in the franchise, Darius Burst: Chronicle Saviours is a horizontally-oriented shoot-'em-up. The player ship travels from left to right, shooting through hordes of enemies, collecting power-ups, and fighting gigantic aquatic-themed bosses.

The "AC Mode" of Darius Burst: Chronicle Saviours includes an ultra-wide playfield, due to the fact that the arcade release of Another Chronicle featured a very large 32:9 ultra-widescreen display. While the gameplay area is letterboxed on PS4 and Vita to compensate, the PC release also includes support for a true 32:9 dual-monitor mode by using two 16:9 displays.

Branching stage routes -- another Darius series staple -- also make their return, allowing new stages to be experienced every time you play the game.

The PS4 and PC versions include support for four-player local multiplayer.

Modes

  • AC Mode: A collection of modes based on the arcade version of Darius Burst: Another Chronicle EX.
    • Original: Choose three stages to play via a branching stage select system, with 12 stages in total, labeled with the letters A through L.
    • Original EX: Similar to Original, but with a different, harder set of stages, labeled with the letters O through Z.
    • Chronicle Mode: A network-based mode where groups of players work together asynchronously to collectively clear over 3000 stages in total.
  • CS Mode: Exclusive to the home version. Features over 200 stages in total that are gradually unlocked through play, including new ships and bosses.
game.name: Darius Burst: Chronicle Saviours

game.deck: A remake of the Korean developed first-person horror game of the same name being released for mobile devices, PC and PlayStation VR.
game.description:
Overview

White Day: A Labyrinth Named School is a reimagining of a Korean horror game of the same name that was originally released by Sonnori and Wizard Soft for the PC in 2001. Both titles are first-person adventure games about a student trapped inside his high school after dark while being hunted by a murderous janitor that stalks its halls. The remake was created by a company founded by the development team of the first White Day called ROI Games and was released in South Korea for Android devices on November 19, 2015. ROI Games has announced plans to port the remake to iOS, PC, and PlayStation 4 as a VR title sometime in the future.

Development

The remake of White Day: A Labyrinth Named School was initially announced in March of 2014 as a direct port of the original game for the iPhone called White Day: In Your Hands. The port was being co-developed by the newly resurrected Sonnori, who had been out of business for a few years at this point, and another Korean developer named Gachyon Soft. However, as development continued, new material kept on being added to the game, including redone graphics, additional story content, and new ghosts among other features that the team wanted to include in the first game back in 2001. The title was later reannounced in January of 2015 as a remake and development switched to the team's new company, RIO Games. Finally, in November of the same year, White Day: A Labyrinth Named School was released on T-Store, a Korean Android marketplace, where it was met with high praise and strong sales, quickly becoming the best selling game of all time on the site.
game.name: Whiteday
